page.title: 07Brahan Estate
page.content: Most of the village of Maryburgh is built upon land once owned by the Mackenzies of Seaforth.Nowadays the estate is much reduced in size but the Brahan Estate still exists and extends from Maryburgh in the east to Marybank in the west.Up till the mid 1950's Brahan Castle stood at the centre of the estate but it was demolished owing to its advanced state of disrepair.Nowadays it is still possible to trace the outline of the castle foundations in the grassy field where once it stood.All that remains is the coachhouse and stables which are now a house and the old castle larder.Much of the castle gardens and woodland walks still exist and the woodland walk known locally as "The Dell"is a popular local walk.The path winds its way from the castle site to the River Conon,ending on the banks of
